UK游댉 /d톩s틛토a톩z/ US游댉/d톩s틛토a톩z/
Definitions:
“Disguise” means to change the way you look or act so that people won’t recognize you. It’s like playing dress-up or pretending to be someone else to hide who you really are. For example, if you wear a mask or a hat to a party so your friends don’t recognize you at first, that’s a disguise.
(verb) to alter one’s appearance or behavior in order to conceal one’s identity or to deceive someone.
Example: The spy disguised herself as a tourist to avoid detection.
(verb) to give a different appearance or impression of something, usually in order to make it more attractive or acceptable.
Example: The marketing team disguised the bitter taste of the medicine with a sweet flavor.
(noun) a false appearance or behavior that is intended to deceive someone.
Example: The robber wore a disguise to conceal his identity.
Idioms & Phrases:
in disguise: not in one’s true appearance or identity.
Example: The superhero often walks around in disguise to avoid being recognized.
disguise one’s feelings: to hide one’s emotions or thoughts.
Example: Sarah disguised her disappointment with a smile when she didn’t get the job.
wear a disguise: to wear a costume or a mask to change one’s appearance.
Example: The spy wore a disguise to blend in with the crowd and avoid detection.
in plain disguise: to be obvious or easy to recognize despite attempting to conceal one’s identity.
Example: The celebrity tried to go incognito at the airport, but her bright pink hat was a dead giveaway in plain disguise.
disguised as: to pretend to be something or someone else in order to deceive or avoid detection.
Example: The thief disguised himself as a maintenance worker to sneak into the building undetected.
a blessing in disguise: something that seems bad or unfortunate at first, but later turns out to be good.
Example: Losing my job was a blessing in disguise because it forced me to pursue my dream career.
Word Origins:
The word “disguise” comes from the Old French word “desguiser,” which means “to change one’s appearance” or “to hide.” The prefix “dis-” means “apart” or “away,” and the root word “guise” means “appearance” or “manner.”
Story Time庸뙾nOnce upon a time, in a small village, there was a mischievous fox named Freddy. Freddy was always getting into trouble, stealing from the other animals and causing chaos wherever he went. One day, he heard that a group of hunters were coming to the forest to catch him and his friends. Freddy knew he had to do something to avoid being caught.
So, he came up with a plan. He would disguise himself as a sheep, a harmless and innocent animal, so the hunters wouldn’t recognize him. He found some wool and tied it around his body, making himself look as fluffy and harmless as possible. Then, he went out into the fields where the sheep were grazing.
At first, the other animals didn’t recognize him. They thought he was just another sheep grazing in the field. But as time went on, they began to suspect that something was off about him. His behavior was strange, and he didn’t quite fit in with the rest of the sheep. Despite their suspicions, however, they couldn’t quite put their finger on what was different about him.
Meanwhile, the hunters arrived in the forest, looking for Freddy and his friends. They searched high and low, but they couldn’t find any trace of the wily fox. They began to grow frustrated and decided to call off the search.
Just as they were leaving, however, one of the hunters spotted Freddy in the field. “Hey, look over there!” he shouted. “That sheep looks different from the others. It must be Freddy in disguise!”
The other hunters were skeptical at first, but as they got closer, they began to see that the “sheep” was indeed Freddy. They quickly caught him and took him away, ending his days of mischief and mayhem.
As it turned out, Freddy’s disguise had been a blessing in disguise. It had kept him safe from the hunters for a while, but in the end, it was what gave him away. Freddy learned that disguises could be useful, but they also had their limits. He realized that he needed to change his ways and start being more honest and trustworthy if he wanted to live a happy and peaceful life.
